intro: Epidendrum pium, commonly known as the pink lady's slipper orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, pinkish-purple flowers that resemble a slipper, often with a contrasting white or yellow lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments.
